jobs.title: Engagement Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

What You'll Do:

  • Be the voice of the customer: Deeply understand and advocate for the most pressing needs of our customers, ensuring this is a north star across the company.

  • Own strategic accounts: Serve as the single point of contact for our highest‑value customers, from onboarding through renewal and expansion.

  • Define & track ROI: Establish metrics—booked revenue, marketing revenue, ticket value lift—and build dashboards that prove Netic’s impact quarter over quarter.

  • Drive outcomes, not tickets: Coordinate engineering, data, and GTM resources to smash blockers and deliver measurable value on aggressive timelines.

  • Navigate exec conversations: Lead QBRs, handle escalations, and reset expectations with clarity and authority—preventing churn before it appears.

  • Hunt new ideas: Spot new use‑cases, craft business cases, and partner with engineering & sales to turn satisfied customers into multi‑year, multi‑product advocates.

What You'll Bring:

  • Services pedigree: 3+ years building, scaling, or investing in essential service businesses in industries like home services, healthcare, automotive.

  • Financial rigor: Background in PE, investment banking, consulting or industry roles that demanded financial modeling, KPI dissection, and board‑level storytelling.

  • Analytical sharpness: Capable in SQL/BI tools; you translate data into executive‑ready insights and ROI narratives.

  • Thrives under pressure: Proven track record managing high‑stakes issues and aligning multiple stakeholders around action plans.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

  • Lose sleep over the "almost perfect"

  • Show internal locus of control

  • Prioritize finesse: refinement of first principles thinking, execution, and craftsmanship

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Product
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

Product Engineers at Netic build the features that put AI in the hands of real businesses. This role combines technical excellence with customer empathy, crafting products that make complex AI feel simple and delivering immediate value to essential service industries.

What You'll Do:

  • Build agentic products: Design, code, and ship full-stack features for Netic's AI platform.

  • Co‑create with customers: Work closely with our customers to understand workflows, gather feedback, and turn pain points into features that stick.

  • Own end‑to‑end delivery: Drive projects from spec to production, handling data models, APIs, front‑end polish, and post‑launch iteration.

  • Ensure quality: Build, test, and monitor features in production to ensure reliability and performance.

What You'll Bring:

  • Proven product builder: 2+ years delivering user‑facing software at scale; you’ve carried features through multiple release cycles.

  • Full‑stack fluency: Comfortable with React, TypeScript, Python; experience with databases and cloud infrastructure.

  • AI experience (nice‑to‑have): Hands‑on with LLM APIs, embeddings, or RAG patterns—or hunger to learn fast.

  • Customer empathy: Track record of translating stakeholder goals into crisp technical specs and delightful products.

  • Founder‑level ownership: You run toward ambiguity, write clean code quickly, and see failures as data for the next sprint.

  • Excellent communicator: Able to explain architectural trade‑offs to eng and business outcomes to execs.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

  • Lose sleep over the "almost perfect"

  • Show internal locus of control

  • Prioritize finesse: refinement of first principles thinking, execution, and craftsmanship

jobs.title: Founding Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

What You’ll Do:

  • Hit aggressive revenue targets: Own quota and forecast accuracy for six‑ and seven‑figure ACV deals for mid-market and enterprise service companies.

  • Architect GTM playbooks: Design outbound cadences, event strategies, and partner motions that scale beyond founder‑led selling.

  • Prospect with precision: Map power structures, craft the perfect cold-email, and build multi‑threaded relationships that survive procurement drag.

  • Translate AI to ROI: Demo our AI revenue engine in the customer's language—showing measurable uplift in revenue and booked jobs—not tech jargon.

  • Run complex cycles: Navigate legal, security, and integration hurdles; drive pilots to production, then land‑and‑expand, taking full ownership.

  • Close the feedback loop: Feed market insights back to product and engineering so we ship the features that unblock larger contracts.

What You’ll Bring:

  • Enterprise sales pedigree: 3+ years selling technical software to mid-market or enterprise, with multi‑stakeholder sign‑off.

  • AI / data fluency: Comfortable explaining AI workflows, API integrations, and related concepts with both CTOs and operators.

  • Founder‑level grit: Proven record of building pipeline from zero, crafting materials, and iterating the pitch without enablement hand‑holding.

  • In‑person gravitas: Eager to travel regularly to spend time onsite with customers.

  • Vertical intuition: Experience selling into operationally intense service industries preferred.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

jobs.title: Founding Technical Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

Our Founding Technical Recruiter will build the team that builds the AI revenue engine. This role combines strategic talent acquisition with hands-on recruiting, finding the exceptional engineers and operators who can solve the hardest problems in applied AI.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own full‑cycle hiring: Drive sourcing → close for engineers, ML researchers, and GTM technologists; you’re the single threaded owner on every job req.

  • Build outbound machinery: Design repeatable email, LinkedIn, and community hunts that surface 10× builders long before they’re on the market.

  • Craft the right filters: Build out role‑specific rubrics, technical screens, and onsite loops that predict on‑the‑job success.

  • Sell the mission: Deliver a crisp, credible pitch on Netic’s frontier‑AI moat that converts “maybe” candidates into same‑day signers.

  • Instrument & iterate: Track funnel metrics, time‑to‑hire, and close rates; turn data into weekly process tweaks that keep the bar high and the pipeline fast.

What You’ll Bring:

  • Technical talent pedigree: 3+ years recruiting technical talent in high‑growth startups or top‑tier agencies.

  • Sourcing excellence: Demonstrated top tier sourced‑> hire ratio and mastery of advanced search, referral loops, and niche communities.

  • Process architect chops: Proven ability to spin up scalable interview frameworks and ATS automations without drowning candidates in steps.

  • Storytelling edge: Track record turning complex tech visions into narratives that close passive candidates against big research lab‑level offers.

  • Data discipline: Comfort owning funnel dashboards, A/B‑testing outreach, and using metrics to kill low‑yield tactics fast.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Product Infrastructure
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

As a founding Product Infrastructure Engineer, you’ll architect and scale the backbone supporting our autonomous AI agents—tackling real-world challenges with immediate, tangible impact. You’ll collaborate with a driven team of builders to shape infrastructure and processes from the ground up, leveraging cutting-edge cloud and orchestration technologies. If you thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments and are excited to set new standards in the agentic space, this is your opportunity to build and leave your mark.

What You'll Do

  • Build cloud infrastructure: Design and operate the backbone that hosts our AI agents and supports our platform.

  • Automate operations: Create infrastructure as code and automated deployment pipelines for reliable releases.

  • Enable scale: Implement systems that handle usage spikes gracefully through autoscaling and multi-region support.

  • Create observability: Build monitoring, logging, and dashboards that provide real-time visibility into system health.

  • Maintain security: Implement security best practices including IAM, network segmentation, and audit trails.

What You'll Bring

  • Infrastructure experience: 4+ years running distributed systems at scale with a major cloud platforms (we use GCP but AWS and Azure is great, too).

  • Automation skills: Proven record of owning infrastructure-as-code and CI/CD pipelines (Terraform, Git Actions, etc).

  • Performance expertise: Experience optimizing systems and databases to meet latency and cost targets under multi-modal workloads. For example, experience with pgBouncer, Kubernetes-based autoscaling, and similar tools.

  • Observability knowledge: Fluent with modern monitoring and tracing tooling (we use Datadog) and built-in tools in Vercel or GCP.

  • Security awareness: Understanding of enterprise security requirements and compliance needs like authentication and service proxies.

  • Product mindset: Treat infrastructure as a product and prioritize ambiguous requirements to see around the corner for 1-2 years ahead of our current systems—measure impact and iterate continuously.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

  • Lose sleep over the "almost perfect"

  • Show internal locus of control

  • Prioritize finesse: refinement of first principles thinking, execution, and craftsmanship

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Forward Deployed Agent Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

Our Forward Deployed Agent Engineers are at the heart of building AI that transforms how essential services businesses operate. This role combines cutting-edge AI development with real-world impact, creating systems that handle complex business operations autonomously.

What You’ll Do:

  • Architect agents: Build and ship multi-modal AI agents that drive business impact for essential service companies.

  • Co‑build with customers: Work directly with enterprise stakeholders to map workflows and deploy our product to unlock immediate revenue lift.

  • Own end‑to‑end lifecycle: Manage everything from design to implementation to rollout, including deployment, measuring success, and iterating with customers.

  • Ensure scalability: Build reliable systems that support thousands of concurrent interactions with strong performance.

  • Run rapid experiments: Evaluate cutting‑edge text/voice models, fine‑tune, A/B test live, and iterate in tight feedback loops.

  • Elevate the platform: Surface patterns and opportunities across customers to inform product and engineering roadmaps.

What You’ll Bring:

  • Production experience: 2+ years building and maintaining production systems using Python (asyncio, FastAPI) and TypeScript (Node, React).

  • AI systems expertise: Hands-on experience with LLM, TTS and speech APIs, fine-tuning models, vector databases, RAG, and evaluation frameworks.

  • Performance focus: Ability to meet SLAs, resolve issues, and optimize systems for speed and reliability at scale.

  • Scale mindset: Experience building production monitoring and debugging systems across cloud infrastructure and databases.

  • Customer obsession: Comfortable engaging directly with customers to troubleshoot issues, understand edge cases, and deliver fast solutions.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

jobs.title: Founding Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

As founding data engineer, you’ll build the foundation that powers our AI agents' decision-making. This role combines cutting-edge data infrastructure with real business impact, creating systems that transform messy real-world data into reliable intelligence for autonomous operations.

What You’ll Do:

  • Unify data sources: Ingest customer interactions, CRM events, and external data into a single, schema-managed data platform.

  • Build real-time pipelines: Create streaming data pipelines and low-latency materialized views that feed agents and ML features.

  • Ensure data quality: Implement automated checks, lineage tracking, and alerting to maintain data integrity.

  • Serve ML & analytics: Design feature stores and analytics marts that power both online inference and executive dashboards.

  • Optimize at scale: Tune systems to handle terabytes of data efficiently while managing costs.

What You’ll Bring:

  • Data engineering experience: 3+ years building batch and streaming pipelines in Python/Scala/Go with Spark, Flink, or Beam.

  • Database expertise: Deep SQL skills and hands-on experience with modern data warehouses at scale.

  • Event‑driven architecture: Production experience with streaming platforms and change-data-capture from OLTP stores.

  • Infrastructure skills: Comfort with infrastructure as code, observability stacks, and cloud platforms.

  • Quality rigor: Obsession with accuracy, latency, and uptime for enterprise-grade systems.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

  • Lose sleep over the "almost perfect"

  • Show internal locus of control

  • Prioritize finesse: refinement of first principles thinking, execution, and craftsmanship

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer, New Grad
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

At Netic, we build features that put AI in the hands of real businesses. As an new grad, you'll have a dedicated mentor to guide you through the end-to-end process of supporting customers, shipping features, and iterating quickly.

New grads are expected to start in Summer of 2026 or earlier.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop models: Design, code, and ship full-stack models for Netic's AI platform, tackling everything from evals to insights.

  • Own projects end-to-end: Drive projects from spec to production, handling data models, APIs, fine-tuning, and post‑launch iteration.

  • Co‑create with customers: Work closely with our customers to understand workflows, gather feedback, and turn pain points into features that stick.

What You'll Learn:

  • AI experience: You'll be hands‑on with LLMs, working with state of the art models and infra.

  • Product and operations collaboration: You'll work daily with folks from other functions to learn how best to apply ML concepts to drive real impact.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

What You'll Do:

  • Build Mission-Critical Systems: Design, develop, and optimize software that powers core business functions for service enterprises.

  • Architect AI Platforms: Create scalable microservices and multi-modal AI systems that integrate cleanly with complex enterprise data.

  • Shape Direction: Partner with leadership to define architecture, make build-vs-buy decisions, and align technical roadmaps with business goals.

  • Solve Performance Challenges: Address latency, throughput, and concurrency challenges; build systems for high uptime and data integrity.

  • Elevate Engineering Standards: Ship clean, well-tested code and drive code reviews, reliability standards, and performance improvements.

  • Mentor Team Members: Pair program, unblock teammates, and share best practices that improve team velocity.

What You'll Bring:

  • System Architecture Experience: 4+ years building and scaling distributed systems; experience leading platform development in high-growth environments.

  • AI Integration Skills: Hands-on experience deploying ML/LLM services to production and running AI agents at scale.

  • Technical Versatility: Proficiency in systems languages (Go/Rust/Java) and scripting languages (Python/TypeScript); ability to choose the right tool for each problem.

  • Operational Excellence: Deep expertise with observability, incident response, CI/CD, containerization, and infrastructure-as-code.

  • Leadership Experience: Track record of mentoring engineers and leading cross-functional projects with measurable impact.

  • Business Understanding: Ability to connect technical decisions to customer value and business outcomes.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

jobs.title: Founding UI/UX Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

Our UI/UX Engineers create the interfaces that make powerful AI feel intuitive. This role is essential to ensuring that complex automation capabilities are accessible to users who aren't technical experts, bridging the gap between frontier technology and customer’s everyday business operations.

What You'll Do:

  • Own the frontend: Architect, build, and iterate on our dashboards and config UIs that let customers steer and trust our AI-powered revenue engine.

  • Ship polished interactions: Translate Figma mocks into pixel‑perfect, responsive components and features.

  • Optimize for speed: Ensure fast load times and smooth interactions through performance optimization.

  • Bridge frontend ↔ backend: Integrate with APIs and real-time data streams effectively.

  • Guard quality & access: Enforce standards, run usability tests, and work with design to evolve our UX system so every release feels cohesive.

What You'll Bring:

  • Frontend expertise: 3+ years with modern JavaScript frameworks, expert HTML/CSS skills.

  • TypeScript proficiency: Strong experience with TypeScript and state management patterns.

  • Performance obsession: Demonstrated ability to optimize frontend performance in production.

  • Testing discipline: Experience with frontend testing tools and practices, with clear drive to deliver polish.

  • Collaborative DNA: Thrive in Figma‑to‑code loops, and rapid iteration with PMs, designers, and backend peers.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

jobs.title: Deployment Strategist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

What You'll Do:

  • Own strategic accounts: Serve as the single point of contact for our highest‑value customers, from onboarding through renewal and expansion.

  • Be the voice of the customer: Deeply understand and advocate for the most pressing needs of our customers, ensuring this is a north star across the company.

  • Define & track ROI: Establish metrics—booked revenue, marketing revenue, ticket value lift—and build dashboards that prove Netic’s impact quarter over quarter.

  • Navigate exec conversations: Lead QBRs, handle escalations, and reset expectations with clarity and authority—preventing churn before it appears.

  • Hunt new ideas: Spot new use‑cases, craft business cases, and partner with engineering & sales to turn satisfied customers into multi‑year, multi‑product advocates.

  • Drive outcomes, not tickets: Coordinate engineering, data, and GTM resources to smash blockers and deliver measurable value on aggressive timelines.

What You'll Bring:

  • Services pedigree: 3+ years building, scaling, or investing in essential service businesses in industries like home services, healthcare, automotive.

  • Financial rigor: Background in PE, investment banking, consulting or industry roles that demanded financial modeling, KPI dissection, and board‑level storytelling.

  • Analytical sharpness: Capable in SQL/BI tools; you translate data into executive‑ready insights and ROI narratives.

  • Thrives under pressure: Proven track record managing high‑stakes issues and aligning multiple stakeholders around action plans.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

At Netic, we build features that put AI in the hands of real businesses. As an intern, you'll have a dedicated mentor to guide you through the end-to-end process of supporting customers, shipping features, and iterating quickly.

12 week internship. Internships are available to start in Summer of 2026 or earlier.

What You'll Do:

  • Build agentic AI products: Design, code, and ship full-stack features for Netic's AI platform, within days.

  • Own projects end-to-end: Drive projects from spec to production, handling data models, APIs, front‑end polish, and post‑launch iteration.

  • Co‑create with customers: Work closely with our customers to understand workflows, gather feedback, and turn pain points into features that stick.

What You'll Learn:

  • Full‑stack fluency: Increase familiarity with React, TypeScript, Python; experience with databases and cloud infrastructure.

  • AI experience: You'll be hands‑on with LLMs, working with state of the art models and infra.

  • Founder‑level ownership: You'll see what it takes to run a successful startup, balancing scrappiness with creativity and technical excellence.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

  • Lose sleep over the "almost perfect"

  • Show internal locus of control

  • Prioritize finesse: refinement of first principles thinking, execution, and craftsmanship

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Applied AI Research Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

As an Applied AI Research Engineer, you’ll dive deep into cutting-edge research, understand the business functions we put on autopilot inside-out, and execute targeted ML projects that deliver pure magic.

What You'll Do:

  • Study the frontier: Track frontier work in traditional ML, LLMs, multimodal models, retrieval, and agentic systems—then distill it into ideas we can ship.

  • Identify high‑ROI projects: Partner with GTM and ops teams to spot bottlenecks in products; define ML projects that unlock significant leverage for customers.

  • Build targeted models: Own the full cycle—data curation, training, evaluation, and deployment—delivering systems that solve real customer pain points.

  • Productionize solutions: Integrate models into our real-time platform via robust APIs and streaming pipelines, ensuring model performance and guardrails from day one.

  • Self‑direct & ship: Operate like a founder—set technical roadmap, validate quickly, and iterate based on real-world results.

What You'll Bring:

  • Deep ML experience: 4+ years with cutting-edge ML techniques; fluent in PyTorch or JAX and modern serving frameworks.

  • Research‑to‑revenue record: Proof you’ve taken novel ML concepts from paper → prod with measurable $$ impact or user growth.

  • Full‑stack pragmatism: Comfortable with ETL, feature stores, cloud-native infrastructure, and A/B experimentation.

  • Data engineering skills: Experience working with complex, real-world data streams and building reliable training pipelines.

  • Product intuition: Ability to understand customer workflows and translate business needs into technical solutions.

  • Ownership model: You default to action, uphold a high craftsmanship bar, and treat failure modes as learning‑rate multipliers.

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Agent Infrastructure
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Netic is the AI revenue engine that handles multi-modal workflows, generates new demand, and drives measurable revenue for the $500B+ essential service industries that keep America running.

With $20M in funding from Founders Fund and Greylock, we've built technology that has autonomously booked tens of thousands of service appointments and generated millions in incremental revenue in just our first year. You'll join us in bringing frontier AI to the physical economy, where the problems are hard, the data is complex, and the impact is immediate and tangible.

As an Agent Infrastructure Engineer, you’ll architect and scale the backbone supporting our autonomous AI agents—tackling real-world challenges with immediate, tangible impact. You’ll collaborate with a driven team of builders to shape infrastructure and processes from the ground up, leveraging cutting-edge cloud and orchestration technologies. If you thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments and are excited to set new standards in the agentic space, this is your opportunity to build and leave your mark.

What You'll Do

  • Build cloud infrastructure: Design and operate the backbone that hosts our AI agents and supports our platform.

  • Automate operations: Create infrastructure as code and automated deployment pipelines for reliable releases.

  • Enable scale: Implement systems that handle usage spikes gracefully through autoscaling and multi-region support.

  • Create observability: Build monitoring, logging, and dashboards that provide real-time visibility into system health.

  • Maintain security: Implement security best practices including IAM, network segmentation, and audit trails.

What You'll Bring

  • Infrastructure experience: 4+ years running distributed systems at scale with a major cloud platforms (we use GCP but AWS and Azure is great, too).

  • Automation and engineering efficiency skills: Proven record of owning infrastructure-as-code and CI/CD pipelines (Terraform, Git Actions, etc).

  • Performance expertise: Experience optimizing systems and databases to meet latency and cost targets under multi-modal workloads. For example, experience with pgBouncer, Kubernetes-based autoscaling, and similar tools.

  • Observability knowledge: Fluent with modern monitoring and tracing tooling (we use Datadog) and built-in tools in Vercel or GCP.

  • Security awareness: Understanding of enterprise security requirements and compliance needs like authentication and service proxies.

  • Product mindset: Treat infrastructure as a product and prioritize ambiguous requirements to see around the corner for 1-2 years ahead of our current systems—measure impact and iterate continuously.

  • Exposure to AI infrastructure and LLMs. Experience with hosting agents or with LLMs or an interest in experimenting with LLMs - even in your own free time!

We believe fulfillment comes from producing your best work with the smartest people together in one room. All roles are in person, in SF (our office is across from Fort Mason). What brings us together is our commitment to:

  • Live to build

  • Run through walls and win

  • Obsess over customers in each line of code

  • Lose sleep over the "almost perfect"

  • Show internal locus of control

  • Prioritize finesse: refinement of first principles thinking, execution, and craftsmanship

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
